title: Dominican Republic: Citi Foundation Co-Finances ProSavings Initiative
summary: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic - The National Savings and Loan Association (ALNAP) today signed a collaborative agreement with the ProSavings initiative. The agreement, led by the Inter-American Development Bank's Multilateral Investment Fund (FOMIN), promotes the development of sustainable strategies for offering liquid and contractual savings products and services to low-income recipients of conditional cash transfers in Latin America and the Caribbean.
tag-1: Dominican Republic: Citi Foundation Co-Finances ProSavings Initiative
tag-2: Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic – The National Savings and Loan Association (ALNAP) today signed a collaborative agreement with the ProSavings initiative. The agreement, led by the Inter-American Development Bank's Multilateral Investment Fund (FOMIN), promotes the development of sustainable strategies for offering liquid and contractual savings products and services to low-income recipients of conditional cash transfers in Latin America and the Caribbean.
tag-3: The Citi Foundation has co-financed the ProSavings initiative since 2011 as part of its commitment to promoting financial inclusion and asset accumulation and preservation in the region. The ProSavings initiative has signed cooperative agreements with six microcredit organizations in four countries in the region, including the new collaboration with ALNAP, which gives 8,400 female beneficiaries of conditional cash transfer programs access to formal savings products. In the Dominican Republic, the initiative has developed savings products that complement the delivery mechanisms for such transfers.
tag-4: "The Citi Foundation and Citi Latin America's Community Development Team believe that in addition to sponsoring financial training and empowerment programs, it is very important to support initiatives that promote the design and provision of financial products and services in accordance with the real conditions experienced by beneficiaries," explained Sergio Barrero, Regional Director of Community Development at Citi Latin America.
tag-5: The Citi Foundation has committed a total of US$1 million in support for the ProSavings program in 2011-2013 as part of this vision and has participated in the collaborations formalized at today's event.
tag-6: The support for ProSavings is just one of a portfolio of programs to be implemented in 2013 with Citi Foundation financing. Coordinated by Citi Dominican Republic, these programs include collaborations with ASPIRE to create awareness about managing debt, budgets and savings by training micro-entrepreneurs and community leaders; Junior Achievement to implement the Women Entrepreneurs program, which combines elements of business development, finance and microfinance capabilities to enable women to start their own ventures and become financially independent; and the annual Citi Micro-entrepreneurship Award, which recognizes the importance of this sector in the Dominican Republic via 19 awards presented at an end-of-year ceremony.
tag-7: The Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation is committed to the economic empowerment and financial inclusion of individuals and families, particularly those in need, in the communities where we work so that they can improve their standard of living. Globally, the Citi Foundation targets its strategic giving to priority focus areas: Microfinance, Enterprise Development, Youth Education and Livelihoods, and Financial Capability and Asset Building. The Citi Foundation works with its partners in Microfinance and Enterprise Development to support environmental programs and innovations. Additional information can be found at www.citifoundation.com.
